conclusion: Identify the current position of the light source and the shadows (A, B, C, D) it casts on the ground.
The light source is currently positioned to the front right of the objects.
Shadow A is cast to the left of the object it corresponds to.
Shadow B is cast to the right of the object it corresponds to.
Shadow C is cast to the left of the object it corresponds to.
Shadow D is cast to the right of the object it corresponds to.
Consider the change in the position of the light source.
The light source moves to the back left above the objects.
Analyze how the shadows will change based on the new position of the light source.
When the light source moves to the back left, the shadows will shift to the opposite side of the objects.
Shadow A, which was previously cast to the left, will now be cast to the right.
Shadow B, which was previously cast to the right, will now be cast to the right (since it was already on the right side, it will remain on the right but move further to the right).
Shadow C, which was previously cast to the left, will now be cast to the right.
Shadow D, which was previously cast to the right, will now be cast to the right (since it was already on the right side, it will remain on the right but move further to the right).
Conclude the changes in the position of the shadows.
Shadow A moves to the right.
Shadow B moves to the right.
Shadow C moves to the right.
Shadow D moves to the right.
Final Answer: A moves to the right, B moves to the right, C moves to the right, D moves to the right.
